## R Markdown

# lncRNA Tutorial: A Step-by-Step Guide to lncRNA Identification and Functional Analysis

This tutorial demonstrates how to use the `lncRna` R package to identify long non-coding RNAs (lncRNAs) from transcriptomic data, evaluate coding potential prediction tools, and perform functional annotation and visualization. The script is divided into clear sections with detailed explanations and code snippets.

## 1. Setup

This section prepares your R environment by installing and loading necessary packages and defining custom operators.

### 1.1 Install and Load 'devtools'
```R
# Install 'devtools' from CRAN if not already installed
if (!requireNamespace("devtools", quietly = TRUE)) {
  install.packages("devtools")
}
library(devtools)  # Load devtools for GitHub package installation

# Install 'lncRna' from the 'test' branch on GitHub
# Increase timeout if needed: options(timeout = 400)
install_github("prodakt/lncRna@test", force = TRUE)
library(lncRna)  # Load the package

### 1.2 Install and Load 'lncRna' from GitHub

Installs the lncRna package from the test branch of your GitHub repository.

'''R
# Install 'lncRna' from GitHub (test branch)
install_github("prodakt/lncRna@test", force = TRUE)
library("lncRna")

### 1.3 Load Other Required R Packages

Loads additional packages using a helper function from lncRna.

'''R
# Load additional packages
load_packages(additional_packages = c("dplyr", "patchwork"), "plotly")
